attributes.action: make works pension tax free if getting less than £2000 in a year
attributes.additional_details: for example if you have a tax allowance of £11500 and you are getting a state pension of say £6000 a year they deduct that amount you get from the state from your tax allowance reducing it to £5500 so anything you get from your works pension above £5500 is taxed leaving you with a smaller pension they don't make that clear when they are asking you to take out a works pension
attributes.background: when you receive your state pension you get it tax free but the works pension that you have been paying most of your working life is not tax free what's more to the point your tax code is even reduced so you pay more tax on it
